title: Weybourne To Sheringham Walk Route

nearby.description: Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path

images.title: Weybourne beach by Jonathan Billinger, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Weybourne beach

images.title: Evelyn Simak / Eroding clifftops
images.caption: Eroding clifftops. Erosion is evident all along the coastline, here the track denoting the Norfolk Coast Path/Peddars Way is slowly falling into the sea; the waves of the North Sea undermine the cliffs and cause large sections to tumble onto the beaches. About 2.5 metres (in some sections up to 5 metres) of headland is lost every year.

images.title: Elliott Simpson / Heading west on the Peddar's Way and Norfolk Coast Path
Looking east along the North Norfolk coast path by Mark Hobbs, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking east along the North Norfolk coast path near Sheringham

images.title: James Haynes / In the gardens near the seafront in Sheringham
images.caption: In the gardens near the seafront in Sheringham

description: This walk takes you along a section of the Peddars Way and Norfolk Coast Path from Weybourne To Sheringham. The walk runs for a distance of just under 4 miles along an eroding cliff top path on the North Norfolk coast. Along the way there are some splendid sea views, pebbly beaches and the Sheringham Golf course to see. The route also skirts the edge of the expansive Sheringham Park where you could extend your outing on one of the many woodland and parkland trails. If you continue east from Sheringham you could visit West Runton where you can enjoy a climb to Beacon Hill, the highest point in the county of Norfolk.
display_address: Hammond Cottage, The Street, Abbey Farm, Weybourne, North Norfolk, Norfolk, England, NR25 7AH, United Kingdom
